cause.description:
Our system is broken in several ways:
- Third parties are systematically excluded by the current duopoly. This could be fixed, or at least remedied, by public election financing and instant runoff voting.
- Voters are disenfranchised, by voter fraud and voter caging, among other deplorable practices.
- Electronic voting machines using closed-source technology prevent the electorate from exercising its right to oversee and adjudicate the fairness of our elections.
- The electoral college ensures that only a few "swing states" receive significant attention from Presidential candidates; moreover, the EC ensures that a Presidential vote in a more populous state, such as California or New York, has significantly less impact than one from a less populous state such as Wyoming or Idaho.
1. The American electoral system is broken.
2. It must be fixed.
cause.mission: Fix the broken electoral system in America.
cause.name: Electoral Reform to Save Our Democracy
